alert.note: Alert for Alameda (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 10:28AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and runoff continues. * WHERE...Alameda Creek near Niles * WHEN...Until 600 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1017 AM PST, River gauge report on Alameda Creek near Niles remain in moderate flood stage. At 10 am, the gauge had risen to 13.7 ft. Latest forecast indicates the creek will crest shortly and will begin to gradually recede through the rest of the day. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fremont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
